The settlement statement provides you with more information for each processed currency. In the example below, the statement provides a breakdown of transactions processed in USD. Below are some of the key terms you will find in this statement: * **Sales Volume**: This represents successfully captured transactions, showing all sales that were done and approved through your account. * **Refunds**: The amount displayed in the field corresponds to refunds performed for your account. * **Net Chargeback Amount**: This is the chargeback plus the Pre-Arbitration amounts minus Representment and Reversal amounts.  
Upload an image...
settlement-statement-1.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

**Merchant Service Fees**: according to your terms in the service agreement, a fixed fee for a transaction is usually charged to your account according to the status in the ActionCodeResponse field.

**Reserve Account Movements**: This part highlights how much rolling reserve was held and release for that specific processing currency.

**Adjustments**: In the event that any manual adjustment took place on the settled amount, the figure will be clearly displayed in this part.

**Amount Carried Forward From Previous Statements**: This section will display amounts that did not meet the minimum settlement threshold in the previous settlement period.
